did.unittitle: Joseph W. Thomas & Sons nursery records

bioghist.p: Joseph W. Thomas & Sons nursery in Tredyffrin Township, Chester County, PA, was established in 1853 and closed in about 1990. Also known as the Chester Valley Nursery, they business supplied trees and shrubs to the surrounding area.

scopecontent.p: Records include account books, nursery plate books and several folders of related papers. Account books include about 36 volumes that record plants sold from about 1893 to 1990. Other account books include cash books, records of salesmen's clients, list of nursery stock for spring 1890. Plate books (3 volumes) include "The Nurseryman's Specimen Book of American Hortufulture and Floriculture, Fruits, Flowers, Ornamental Treets, Shrubs, Rose, &c." (not dated) Also in box are two volumes seemingly unrelated to the above: minute book of the Detective Association Union, 1899-1943 and account book of the Nottingham Detective Association, 1915-1941.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
